aiAnalysis.summary: AFJ Limited's staging environment demonstrates solid foundational security with proper authentication controls on admin endpoints and HTTPS enforcement. However, the application has significant vulnerabilities related to missing HTTP security headers across all scanned pages. Four high-severity issues exist: critical security headers (X-Content-Type-Options, X-Frame-Options) are absent from most pages, and recommended headers (HSTS, CSP, Referrer-Policy, Permissions-Policy) are universally missing. These omissions expose the application to clickjacking, MIME-sniffing attacks, and man-in-the-middle threats, particularly concerning for a transport company handling sensitive business data.
recommendations: Immediately implement X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff across all pages to prevent MIME-sniffing attacks
Add X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN (or DENY if not embedding in iframes) to all pages to prevent clickjackingâ€”currently only present on /admin
Configure Strict-Transport-Security header (HSTS) with a minimum max-age of 31536000 seconds to enforce HTTPS and prevent downgrade attacks
Implement a Content-Security-Policy (CSP) header to restrict resource loading and mitigate XSS vulnerabilities, especially important for the quote and transport service pages handling user input
Add Referrer-Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin to control referrer information leakage across requests
Include Permissions-Policy header to restrict access to sensitive browser features (camera, microphone, geolocation)
Apply all recommended headers consistently across the entire application via web server configuration or middleware to ensure no pages are missed
